p: In order to evenly distribute the contaminants, the predetermined amount of each PDS was poured onto a thinly spread layer of soil on a foil mat using a laboratory pipette. The soil was then thoroughly mixed several times and placed in pots. The area of pot was 706.5 cm 2 (30 cm in diameter). The non-contaminated soil was placed in identical pots and constituted the control treatment. After 1 week, winter wheat ( Triticum aestivum L.) seeds, ‘Batuta’ cultivar, were sown in each pot at an amount of 15 seeds per pot. After sprouting, the plants were thinned out and ten plants were left in each pot to avoid the competition between germinated seedlings. The pot experiment was performed in quadruplicate.
